alert.note: Alert for Custer; Loup (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 15 at 2:17PM CDT until March 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Loup and Custer Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The best snow potential will be late tonight through late morning Thursday. There is a high probability for short duration heavy snow. This combined with strong northerly winds, could lead to white out to near white out conditions at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
